alert.note: Alert for Modoc (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 4:09PM PDT until March 16 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County..Snowmelt continues to add to the Pit River and area streams. As this water moves slowly, be on the lookout for high water in and near streams and rivers as well as ponding on roadways. For the Pit River...including Canby...the forecast is for continued high water that crests about a half foot below flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High water will continue through the night into Wednesday. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Flood stage - Expect minor flooding in Canby Lookout Beiber and Nubeiber California and throughout southwest Modoc and northwest Lassen Counties. 4300 CFS * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest just below flood stage Wednesday night into Thursday morning. It will then fall below action stage just by Thursday night. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 900 AM PDT.
